ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Wing Lunarpine replied as she stood up. he ducked down realizing her gun was drawn. I was following your scent. it was leading me toward the pile.

"Hello Wing" Lunarpine replied as she stood up. he ducked down 
realizing her gun was drawn."I was following your scent. it was 
leading me toward the pile." "Smart move, hiding like that. Dumb move 
hiding in a storm." Lunarpine lowered his arms to his side hoping 
Shadow Wing would do the same. "I was doing a routine recon when I 
caught your scent, care to explain?" Lunarpine wasn't happy with the 
trouble he'd gone through just to have her stick a gun in his face.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She waited, ready to strike when the bot got near.  She scanned the 
> area but couldn't get a reading.  She had snow piled up on her.  
She 
> was nervous.  She wondered if she could even take this bot who was 
> following her. She heard footsteps in the snow.  The bot was 
getting 
> closer.  Soon he would be right on top of her.  She held perfectly 
> still.  She waited until he was right next to her.  She jumped up 
and 
> aimed her gun right in his face. "HOLD IT YOU!..." she froze.  She 
> saw Lunarpine standing there. "What in the Matrix are you doing 
> here?"  
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > The snow had gotten worse, even though the hail had nearly 
stopped, 
> > Lunarpine's senses were on full, his nose to the ground. most 
> scents 
> > were buried beneath the snow. He'd lost the predicons scent a 
while 
> > back. The cold didn't bother him, being from the arctic north 
> > helped. "A storm like this isn't normal anywhere." he thought, 
the 
> > hot jungle below, would be destroyed by such a climate change.
> > (Another temporal distortion perhaps.) Again he opened his comm 
> only 
> > to get static. His senses weren't reliable around here so he 
> > transformed to bot and continued his search for Shadow Wing. For 
> some reason he couldn't shake the fealing he was being watched.
